Package frc.robot

Class Lib4150FilterLowPassBW1

java.lang.Object
frc.robot.Lib4150FilterLowPassBW1
public class Lib4150FilterLowPassBW1 extends Object
This class implements a 1st order low pass butterworth filter using finite differences. This filter smooths an input, reducing noise, while sacrificing resposonsiveness. A small amount of delay or lag is introduced. However often the reduction of noise is worth the additional lag time. After creating the object, the ExecFilter method should be called periodically to smooth the input value. The output value should reach 99 percent of the step change of the input after 5 time constants.
File: Lib4150FilterLowPassBW1.java

Referenceable items: (classes)
Lib4150FilterLowPassBW1

Depends on:
none - no external libraries required

Operating system specifics:
None - transportable

Notes:
For this to work correctly, the execute method needs to be called everytime the input value is acquired.

  • Method Details

    • execFilter

      public double execFilter(double input, double elapsedTime, boolean enable)
      Execute the 1st order low pass butterworth filter. This should be called every execution cycle.
      Parameters:
      input - - double - input value to be filtered.
      elapsedTime - - double - system elapsed time - seconds.
      enable - - boolean - set TRUE to enable the filter. When FALSE the filter is reset and the input is passed through to the output.
      Returns:
      filteredValue - double - filtered input value.

    • execFilter

      public double execFilter(double input, double elapsedTime)
      Execute the 1st order low pass butterworth filter. This should be called every execution cycle.
      Parameters:
      input - - double - input value to be filtered.
      elapsedTime - - double - system elapsed time - seconds.
      Returns:
      filteredValue - double - filtered input value.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset the filter. The saved input and output values are set to zero.

    • reset

      public void reset(double inputValue)
      Reset the filter.
      Parameters:
      inputValue - - double - value to used for the saved inputs and outputs.

    • getTimeConstant

      Get Estimated execution period
      Returns:

    • getAllowedPeriodDifference

      public double getAllowedPeriodDifference()
      Get maximum allowed time period difference before finite difference constants are re-calculated. The initial and default value is 0.005 seconds. Setting this to a very large value will disable finite difference constant recalculation.
      Returns:
      maxAllowedPeriodDifference - double - maximum allowed time period difference - seconds.

    • getInputConstants

      public double[] getInputConstants()
      get calculated input gain constants.
      Returns:
      inputGains - double[] - input gain constants.

    • getOutputConstants

      public double[] getOutputConstants()
      get calculated output gain constants.
      Returns:
      outputGains - double[] - output gain constants.

    • setTimeConstant

      public void setTimeConstant(double timeConstant, double estimatedPeriod)
      Set time consant and estimated execution period. Finite difference constants are recalculated. Time constant must be larger than the estimated execution period. When a step change in the input value occurs, the output will reach 99% of the input value in 5 time constants.
      Parameters:
      timeConstant - - double - time constant - seconds.
      estimatedPeriod - - double - estimated execution period - seconds.

    • setAllowedPeriodDifference

      public void setAllowedPeriodDifference(double allowedPeriodDiffSec)
      Set maximum allowed time period difference before finite difference constants are re-calculated. The initial and default value is 0.005 seconds. Setting this to a very large value will disable finite difference constant recalculation.
      Parameters:
      allowedPeriodDiffSec - - double - max allowed time period difference - seconds.
